intro: Euphorbia buschiana, commonly known as the Busch's spurge, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features a short, thick stem with dense clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it store water, adapting to arid environments. It produces a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin. Euphorbia buschiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
